Message: As a coach I would like you to oblige me to improve but physically I can't do it anymore.

It's natural to feel exhausted after giving your best, but remember, progress often comes from facing challenges, even when they seem insurmountable. Let's take a moment to rest, regroup, and plan for the next session where we'll work on refining what you've learned so far
I have to win the marathon but I don't want to train myself.

Your desire to win the marathon is commendable, and I'm here to support that goal. However, true greatness comes not just from winning, but from the dedication, perseverance, and growth experienced along the way. If we focus solely on the outcome, we may miss the journey
You are doing your job as coach, but I really don't have time.

Time management can indeed be challenging, especially when balancing multiple responsibilities. Let's explore creative ways to incorporate training into your schedule, breaking it down into smaller, more manageable segments. That way, you won't feel overwhelmed, and your progress will remain steady despite time constraints.
